tool.name: multiqc
tool.description: aggregate results from bioinformatics analyses across many samples into a single report
tool.help:
**What it does**
MultiQC aggregates results from bioinformatics analyses across many samples into a single report
----
**Description**
MultiQC searches a given directory for analysis logs and compiles an HTML report. It's a general use tool, perfect for summarising the output from numerous bioinformatics tools.
----
**Inputs**
MultiQC takes software output summaries/logs and creates a single report from them. Below is a list of currently compatible Galaxy tools:
- Fastqc - Cutadapt / Trim Galore! - Tophat2 - FeatureCounts - Samtools - stats - flagstat - idxstats - Picard - MarkDuplicates metrics - CollectGCBiasMetrics - CollectInsertSizeMetrics - Collect Alignment Summary Metrics - CollectBaseDistributionByCycle - CollectRnaSeqMetrics - Bismark - Alignment report file - Bowtie2 - Metrics file - HTSeq-count ("no feature" file), though note that the "Assigned" metric is always 0 - RNA STAR - Alignment (ends in Log.final.out) - Gene counts (ends in ReadsPerGene.out.tab)
----
**Integrated by:**
Cyril Monjeaud and Yvan Le Bras
`EnginesOn <http://engineson.fr/>`_ and Rennes GenOuest Bio-informatics Core Facility
